ngiemboon: Yakwɔ̂b lɔ̌ɔn ńtsẅé Kánàhan, á tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ gẅie tá we la tsẅé wó, ńgwɔ́ kÿoláʼ.
en: Jacob lived in the land where his father had stayed, the land of Canaan.

ngiemboon: Mɔɔn ée mezíŋ pʉ̀a na nkenkÿo ngẅɛ̀ ndá Yakwɔ̂b. Yesyɛ̂b la gwɔ́ tà ńgẅiin ngùʼ ntsɔ̀b sɔɔnmbʉ́a né legém, pâ mefɛ̌ pé pféle menjʉ̀njÿò lâ mvfó. À laa múɔ mbàŋa, ńkwoŋo lézse nzèm gubé Mbila lâ ye Zilépà pie é laa mezwě tá we Yakwɔ̂b. Táʼ, Yesyɛ̂b lɔ̌ɔn ńgwá ḿbíte meshwóŋò tepòŋ mie é kẅɛɛ ncwò mefɛ̌ pé, éshwóŋo tá wɔ́b.
en: These are the family records of Jacob.

ngiemboon: Yakwɔ̂b lɔ̌ɔn ńkwoŋo Yesyɛ̂b, ńcʉa yetsɔ́ gubé yé yembàŋa ntsèm. Ńtí páʼ à laa múɔ gẅie à la zẅiŋ tá ńzyé. À la gÿo ńtém nzsǒ sɔ́ʼ ńná né Yesyɛ̂b.
en: Now Israel loved Joseph more than his other sons because Joseph was a son born to him in his old age,   and he made a long-sleeved robe  # 37:3 Or an ornate robe; see 2Sm 13:18,19 for him.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ̌ Yesyɛ̂b gyá ngie tá wɔ́b kwoŋo yé ńcʉa wɔ́b metsèm, ńzyete lépʉa Yesyɛ̂b, ńcʉ́ʼʉ ńdɔgɔ pɔ́ mbÿàg lóŋ, ńgɔɔn nò né yé.
en: When his brothers saw that their father loved him more than all his brothers, they hated him and could not bring themselves to speak peaceably to him.

ngiemboon: Á gÿo ńgwɔ́ tsɔ́ lyɛ̌ʼ, Yesyɛ̂b lyé tsɔ̌ njÿòon, ḿbíte éshwóŋ mefɛ̌ pé. Pɔ́ júʼ, ńgíŋe ńkẅiʼi ḿbʉa yé.
en: Then Joseph had a dream. When he told it to his brothers, they hated him even more.

ngiemboon: À la gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Shúshu, pi júʼ tsɔ̌ njÿòon gie n ně ńdyé:
en: He said to them, “Listen to this dream I had:

ngiemboon: «N ně ńdyé njÿòon, ńgyá pege gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ nkáʼ, mbà pege kwɛté membwɔ̀ʼ ngesáŋ ntsíŋ, n deen ńgyá, eyɔ̀ɔn mbwɔ̀ʼ pʉʼʉ ńtyé tyé; emí membwɔ̀ʼ tÿɔ́ʼte yɔ̀ɔn, ńŋwéʼte, ésɔb metwó mɔ́b ssé, á mvfò yɔ̀ɔn mbwɔ̀ʼ.»
en: There we were, binding sheaves of grain in the field. Suddenly my sheaf stood up, and your sheaves gathered around it and bowed down to my sheaf.”

ngiemboon: Mefɛ̌ pé zɛ́te yé ngie: «Ɔ̀ lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie ɔ̀ ge gÿo cʉ́ʼʉ fùɔ weg keen? Kà pɔ́ ngie gù zɔ ge cʉ́ʼʉ sáʼa wég?» Pɔ́ gɔɔn púʼu, ńgíŋe ńkẅiʼi ḿbʉa yé, ńtí menjÿòon mé lâ meshwóŋè mé.
en: “Are you really going to reign over us? ” his brothers asked him. “Are you really going to rule us? ” So they hated him even more because of his dream and what he had said.

ngiemboon: À la tǎa ńgíŋe ńdyé tsɔ̌ njÿòon tsɔ́ lyɛ̌ʼ, ńgíŋe ḿbíte, éshwóŋ mefɛ̌ pé ńgɔɔn ngie: «N gǐŋ ńdyé tsɔ́ njÿòon, ńgyá nèm, ńgyá saŋ, ńgÿo mecÿɔ́ʼsaŋ ntsɔ̀b wémɔʼɔ́ né legém, é ne ńŋwɔ́ʼɔ nnɛ́ mvfò mèŋ.»
en: Then he had another dream and told it to his brothers. “Look,” he said, “I had another dream, and this time the sun, moon, and eleven stars were bowing down to me.”

ngiemboon: À la píte púʼu, éshwóŋo tá we, éshwóŋ mefɛ̌ pé. Táʼ, tá we cÿɔ́gte yé, ńzɛ́te yé ngie: «Ee yɛ̌ ntí njÿòon gie ɔ̀ laʼte pɛ́ʼɛ̀? Ɔ̀ lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie peg lâ má gù lâ mefɛ̌ pú ge tó, é ŋwɔ́ʼ nnɛ́ mvfò gù tà zǐ yég kíbe ssé keen?»
en: He told his father and brothers, and his father rebuked him. “What kind of dream is this that you have had? ” he said. “Am I and your mother and your brothers really going to come and bow down to the ground before you? ”

ngiemboon: Mefɛ̌ pé pú ńdíe yé ńkwɔ́ʼɔ lóŋ; táʼ, tá we ké ńnéŋe ńkwaŋte mɔɔn menjÿòon kwaŋte.
en: His brothers were jealous of him,   but his father kept the matter in mind.  # 37:11 Dn 7:28; Lk 2:19,51

ngiemboon: Mefɛ̌ Yesyɛ̂b la gʉa né Sishÿɛ̂m lépféle menjʉ̀njÿò lâ mvfó tá wɔb.
en: His brothers had gone to pasture their father’s flocks at Shechem.

ngiemboon: Á gÿo ńgwɔ́ tsɔ́ lyɛ̌ʼ, Yakwɔ̂b gɔɔn né Yesyɛ̂b ngie: «Mefɛ̌ pú té Sishÿɛ̂m ḿpféle menɔ̀ɔn wɔ́ le? Tóo, n túmo gú wó!» Yesyɛ̂b tsɔ́ʼ ngie: «Oon, n jǔʼ!»
en: Israel said to Joseph, “Your brothers, you know, are pasturing the flocks at Shechem. Get ready. I’m sending you to them.”

ngiemboon: Yakwɔ̂b gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: «Shúshu, gʉa ńdíe kà pɔ́ ée jʉʼó ńgwɔ́ ntentʉ́ wɔ́ɔ, tà mbɔɔ menɔ̀ɔn. Gʉa ńdíe wɔ́b, ḿbiŋ ńtó shwóŋo wɔ́ɔn páʼ pɔ́ ée jʉʼó ńgwɔ́.»
en: Then Israel said to him, “Go and see how your brothers and the flocks are doing, and bring word back to me.” So he sent him from the Hebron   Valley, and he went to Shechem.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ ndÿò gyá páʼ aa tsẅɛ ńgwá ḿbúu, ńzɛ́te yé ngie: «Ɔ̀ faʼa pɔ́ kɔ́?»
en: A man found him there, wandering in the field, and asked him, “What are you looking for? ”

ngiemboon: Á tsɔ́ʼ ngie: «Mèŋ faʼa mefɛ̌ pɔ́ɔn! Shúshu, ngwɔ́ ɔ̀ zsé jʉʼ gie pɔ́ pféle menɔ̀ɔn pɔ́b wó ka?»
en: “I’m looking for my brothers,” Joseph said. “Can you tell me where they are pasturing their flocks? ”

ngiemboon: Andÿò wa tsɔ́ʼ ngie: «Pɔ́ fǒ jʉʼɔɔn ńgʉa; n ka júʼ pɔ́ ne ńgɔɔn ngie pɔ́ ge gʉa né Ndɔtâŋ.» Yesyɛ̂b júʼ púʼu, ńcʉ́me mánzsè, ńké ńgiŋe faʼa mefɛ̌ pé faʼ, tà ńkúu Ndɔtâŋ, ńgyá wɔ́b.
en: “They’ve moved on from here,” the man said. “I heard them say, ‘Let’s go to Dothan.’ ”   So Joseph set out after his brothers and found them at Dothan.

ngiemboon: Yesyɛ̂b la nyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ngʉ̀a shʉ̀shʉ̀a pɔ́ gyá yé, á gwaa gʉa tà kúu lejʉ́ŋ pɔ́b, mbà pɔ́ lɔ̌ɔn ncù wé, páʼ pɔ́ ge zẅé yé.
en: They saw him in the distance, and before he had reached them, they plotted to kill him.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ la ne ńgɔɔn tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ngie: «Andyè menjÿòon wɛ̂ gẅie à tóo lɛ̂.
en: They said to one another, “Oh, look, here comes that dream expert!

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀ʼɔɔn la, pi tó pege zẅé yé, ḿmaʼa yé tsɛ̀ɛ tɔ́ɔn ntse ntǔŋ gie ntse té tsoló wɔ́. Ńzsé ngie pege gÿǒ shwóŋo tá wege ngie nɔ̀ɔn mbàʼ ka gwaa yé. É gyá mmó gie á ge gÿo, tá menjÿòon mé e pumte.»
en: So now, come on, let’s kill him and throw him into one of the pits.   We can say that a vicious animal ate him. Then we’ll see what becomes of his dreams! ”

ngiemboon: Lẅímbèŋ júʼu nò ŋwɛ́, éfaʼ shÿó lékẅé twó Yesyɛ̂b, ńgɔɔn né mefɛ̌ pé ngie: «Tà pege zẅé yé.»
en: When Reuben heard this, he tried to save him from them.   He said, “Let’s not take his life.”  # 37:21 Gn 42:22

ngiemboon: Ńgíŋe ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: «Tà pi pfɛte metse nyìŋ. Pi maʼa yé pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ tɔ́ɔn ntse ntǔŋ yɔɔn gie áa kwòŋotsẅɛ lɔɔn. Pi pɔ́ɔn lézába pwó na yé.» Lẅímbèŋ lɔ̌ɔn ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b púʼu, légwɔ́ gie Yesyɛ̂b ge tsẅɛ́, à gʉa ńtsege yé mbwó tá we.
en: Reuben also said to them, “Don’t shed blood. Throw him into this pit in the wilderness, but don’t lay a hand on him” #— #intending to rescue him from them and return him to his father.

ngiemboon: Yesyɛ̂b gʉa tà ńkúu lejʉ́ŋ mefɛ̌ pé, pɔ́ gwoon yé, ésẅɛ nzsǒsɔ́ʼ mentsaʼá mentsaʼá gie à la maʼ.
en: When Joseph came to his brothers, they stripped off Joseph’s robe, the long-sleeved robe that he had on.

ngiemboon: É maʼa yé tsɛ̀ɛ tsɔ́ tɔ́ɔn ntse ntǔŋ gie ntse té tsoló wɔ́.
en: Then they took him and threw him into the pit. The pit was empty, without water.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ la gÿo púʼu, ńdíe jʉʼ, ńnéŋe wó, lépfɛ́ɛ mmó. Ńdeen ḿmaʼ nÿɔ́g, ńgyá nùɔ ngàŋ legìŋ pʉ̀a Esemayɛ̂ɛ ne fóo Ngalad ńgee né Egíbtò. Mekamɛɛ pɔ́b piʼi laméndɔ̀ɔn mentí tà ńgyɔ́ɔn, páʼ shúm gyě, lâ tÿǒ mbɔ̂m ńgÿo landanẅim.
en: They sat down to eat a meal,   and when they looked up, there was a caravan of Ishmaelites coming from Gilead.  # 37:25 Gn 39:1 Their camels were carrying aromatic gum, balsam, and resin, going down to Egypt.  # 37:25 Gn 43:11; Jr 8:22; 46:11

ngiemboon: Yúndà gɔɔn né mefɛ̌ pé ngie: «Pege lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ páʼɔɔn ńzẅé fɛ̌ wege, ńdÿoon metse mé, mbà pì gie pege gee jÿǒ, áa kɔ́?
en: Judah said to his brothers, “What do we gain if we kill our brother and cover up his blood?

ngiemboon: Pi tó pege cʉ́ʼ sẅiŋe yé pɔ́ mbwó pʉ̀a Esemayɛ̂ɛ. Pege pɔ́ɔn lézába pwó na yé. Ńtí nue aa fɛ̌ wege, pege lâ pɔ̌ gẅiin tàʼ metse.» Yúndà la gɔɔn púʼu, mefɛ̌ pé zẅíŋ.
en: Come on, let’s sell him to the Ishmaelites and not lay a hand on him, for he is our brother, our own flesh,” and his brothers agreed.

ngiemboon: Patáŋ sɔ̌ɔn pie é fóo láʼa Mandyaŋ ne ńcʉa jʉʼó, pɔ́ fó tsɛ̀ɛ tɔ́ɔn ntse ntǔŋ, éshwoŋo Yesyɛ̂b, ńnáa kwóŋ, ésẅiŋe yé mbwó pʉ̀a Esemayɛ̂ɛ. Ńkẅé nkáb pàg móm mbʉ́a. Ngàŋ legìŋ ŋwɛ́, lɔgɔ yé ńgʉa né Egíbtò.
en: When Midianite   traders passed by, his brothers pulled Joseph out of the pit and sold him for twenty pieces of silver to the Ishmaelites, who took Joseph to Egypt.  # 37:28 Gn 45:4–5; Ps 105:17; Ac 7:9

ngiemboon: Lẅímbèŋ la gÿo ńkwɔ́ʼ, ńgʉa jʉʼʉ tɔ́ɔn ntse ntǔŋ, ńgyá Yesyɛ̂b te gíŋe ńgwɔ́ tsoló wɔ́. Á shʉate menzsǒ mé.
en: When Reuben returned to the pit and saw that Joseph was not there, he tore his clothes.

ngiemboon: Ńdeen ńké ḿbiŋ né jʉʼ gie mefɛ̌ pé laa wó. Ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: «N dǐe múɔ wa, n te yé gyá, tà n gee páʼɔɔn ńdɔgɔ yɛ̌ fʉ̀ʼɔɔn?»
en: He went back to his brothers and said, “The boy is gone! What am I going to do? ”

ngiemboon: Ńzáʼa lóŋ tàʼa pwɔ́b, ḿbí nzsǒsɔ́ʼ Yesyɛ̂b, ńtsaba na metse pwɔ́b ŋwɛ́.
en: So they took Joseph’s robe, slaughtered a male goat, and dipped the robe in its blood.

ngiemboon: Ńdeen ńké ńtúm nzsǒsɔ́ʼ ŋwɛ́ gie e laa mentsaʼá mentsaʼá la, ńnáa mbwó tá wɔb. Ńgɔɔn né yé ngie «Gyá mmó gie peg ka gyá. Shúshu, líe jú, kà nzsǒ yɛ̂, ee pɛ́ʼɛ̀ ńgwɔ́ nzsǒ míŋ gù wɔ́ɔ?»
en: They sent the long-sleeved robe to their father and said, “We found this. Examine it. Is it your son’s robe or not? ”

ngiemboon: Yakwɔ̂b líe, ńgaʼte ńgɔɔn ngie: «Eyɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nzsǒ míŋ wɔ̀ɔn, mbà nɔ̀ɔn mbàʼ ka gwaa yé. Awɔɔn mbà mé ka pú ésyɛte Yesyɛ̂b ḿpfɛ́.»
en: His father recognized it. “It is my son’s robe,” he said. “A vicious animal has devoured him. Joseph has been torn to pieces! ”

ngiemboon: Yakwɔ̂b gyá púʼu, éshʉate menzsǒ mé, ńcwóŋo pɔ̀ɔn zẅɛ̌ʼ yé. Ńdɔg ńdʉa míŋ we, tà é gwɔ́ melyɛ̌ʼ tà ńgyɔ́ɔn.
en: Then Jacob tore his clothes, put sackcloth around his waist, and mourned for his son many days.

ngiemboon: Egubé yé ntsèm, é yembàŋa lâ yepanzwě, é láŋte yé lêkɔ́ wɔ́ɔ, à te júʼ. Ńne ńgɔɔn ngie: «N ge lʉa míŋ wɔ̀ɔn tà kwé, é gʉa tsɛ̀ɛ yé, á láʼ mepfó!» Wɔɔn aa páʼ Yakwɔ̂b la lʉa míŋ we Yesyɛ̂b púʼu.
en: All his sons and daughters tried to comfort him, but he refused to be comforted. “No,” he said. “I will go down to Sheol to my son, mourning.” And his father wept for him.

ngiemboon: Táʼ, ńké ńdʉa yé púʼu páʼɔɔn, mbà pʉ̀a Mandyaŋ ka sẅiŋe Yesyɛ̂b á Egíbtò á mbwó Potifaa gẅie à laa máa káŋatwó, yé zɔ̌ tyé twómvfò na papyɛ́b jʉʼ, á nɔʼɔ Falahoŋ.
en: Meanwhile, the Midianites sold Joseph in Egypt to Potiphar, an officer of Pharaoh and the captain of the guards.
